item.title: Trump: 'I don't want to use military force against Iran, but sometimes you have to'
item.summary: He later commented that he would not allow Iran to enrich uranium at all, adding that Tehran 'doesn't want to go quite far enough, and it's too bad.' Meanwhile, several countries recommended their citizens not to visit Israel or Iran amid mounting tensions

item.title: U.S. embassy authorizes staff to depart from Israel citing 'safety risks'
item.summary: USS Gerald R. Ford is expected to dock in Haifa as Omani foreign minister, who mediated Thursday's indirect talks, heads to Washington for talks with VP JD Vance. Trump was reportedly briefed by CENTCOM chief on Thursday on strike options against Iran

item.title: 'Zionist war criminal': Churchill statue in London defaced with pro-Palestinian graffiti
item.summary: A suspect was arrested for allegedly painting 'Zionist war criminal,' 'Stop the Genocide' and 'Free Palestine' beneath a 12-foot statute of Churchill. Dutch group Free the Filton 24, a reference to Palestine Action activists charged with breaking into Elbit's U.K. sites, claim...

item.title: UN nuclear watchdog says Iran storing enriched uranium under Isfahan site
item.summary: The IAEA estimates that Iran had 440.9 kg of uranium enriched to up to 60% before last year's Israeli-U.S. attacks - enough, if enriched further, for 10 nuclear weapons, according to an IAEA yardstick. The agency and Western powers believe the bulk of that is still intact. Was...

item.title: Satellite images show increase in U.S. aircraft at Saudi airbase
item.summary: Saudi Arabia, a longstanding U.S. ally, told Iran it would not allow its airspace or territory to be used for military actions against Tehran. At least 43 U.S. aircraft were visible at a Saudi base on February 21, compared to 27 visible in a February 17 image

item.title: As talk of another Iran war grows, victims of the last round are still in limbo
item.summary: With rebuilding delayed and compensation limited, displaced residents fear another round before the last one is repaired

item.title: As court battle continues, foreign journalists launch campaign urging Israel to lift Gaza access ban
item.summary: Israel has barred foreign journalists from entering Gaza since October 7, 2023, except those embedded within the IDF. For 2 years, the FPA has appealed to the High Court without success. 'Our Palestinian colleagues in Gaza shouldn't bear that burden alone,' said one reporter

item.title: Israel Police, IDF clash over probe into killing of Palestinian-American teen in West Bank
item.summary: Disagreements between the army and Israel police delayed the investigation into Nasrallah Abu Siam's death during a settler raid on his West Bank village, with the IDF ultimately determining that his death was not caused by a soldier. The identity of the shooter remains unknown

item.title: At this small Conservative New Jersey synagogue, a Hebrew Israelite rabbi runs the show
item.summary: Rabbi Eliyahu Collins is breathing new life into the last active synagogue in Newark, New Jersey

item.title: Adam Friedland isn't joking: Israel's war in Gaza 'changed what being Jewish is'
item.summary: The progressive, provocative talk show host dishes on Ritchie Torres, Zionist summer camp, the year he lived in 'the real nothing town' of Petah Tikva and how he discovered the Israel advocacy of his adolescence was 'divorced from the people involved'
